properties.areaDesc: Cumberland, VA; Amelia, VA; Prince Edward, VA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 9:52PM EST until February 8 at 8:52PM EST by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield Va has issued a flood
warning for the following rivers in Virginia...

Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Amelia...Cumberland and
Prince Edward Counties
For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville...Minor flooding is
forecast.

The National Weather Service in Wakefield Va has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Appomattox River Above Farmville.
* from late tonight to Saturday evening...Or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At 09:35 PM Thursday the stage was 11.7 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage by
tomorrow morning and continue to rise to near 17.8 feet by early
Saturday morning. The river will fall below flood stage by Saturday
early afternoon.
* At 18.0 feet...River Rd downstream of the gage near the railroad
bridge begins to flood.
This river level is comparable to a previous crest of 17.7 feet on
Dec 24 2015.
properties.instruction:
Please use extreme caution if venturing near riverbanks. Move to
higher ground immediately should rising water threaten your safety.

Graphical forecast information is available on the internet at
www.weather.gov/akq.  Click on the Rivers and Lakes icon beneath the
point and click forecast map.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather radio for further updates...
